resources.string: Generate Julia Sets by setting the constant and choosing an iteration method.
About app\n Displays black and white julia sets. \n Project home page Based on the Python script \'julia_set.py\' by Tim Meehan, see paulbourke.net/fractals/sinjulia/

About Julia sets. 
 Julia sets are the points created by iterating certain functions of complex numbers in this way: 
 z_0=a+bi
 z_1=f(z_0)
 z_2=f(z_1)
 .
 .
 .
 z_n=f(z_n-1)

If z converges as n -> inf then the z_0-value belongs to the set. 
 If z diverges for large n then the z_0-value does not belong to the set.

The functions used for iteration in this app are
 f(z)=c*sin(z)
 f(z)=c*cos(z)+c
 f(z)=z^2+c
 where c is a complex number that you specify in the app.
